standard_metadata.standard_description: Use place value understanding to round decimals to any place.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Round decimals using a number line

question.content: Answer two questions about the number $1.176$ below.    1. **Which point is at $1.176$ on the number line?**    2. **What is $1.176$ rounded to the nearest tenth?**

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 1 to 2 with tick marks every one tenth unit. Point A appears slightly below tick mark 1.1. Point B appears slightly below tick mark 1.2. Point C appears slightly below tick mark 1.8.

hints.content: Point $\maroonE{\text{B}}$ shows $\maroonE{1.176}$ on the number line.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 1 to 2 with tick marks every one tenth unit. Point B appears slightly below tick mark 1.2.

hints.content: Now, let's look at the $\goldE{\text{tenths}}$.     [[☃ image 2]]  $\maroonE{1.176}$ is between $\goldE{1.1}$ and $\goldE{1.2}$ but closer to $\goldE{1.2}$.  So, $\maroonE{1.176}$ rounds up to $\goldE{1.2}$.

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 1 to 2 with tick marks every one tenth unit. Tick marks 1.1 and 1.2 are highlighted. Point B appears slightly below tick mark 1.2.

hints.content: Point $\maroonE{\text{B}}$ shows $\maroonE{1.176}$ on the number line.  $\maroonE{1.176}$ rounded to the nearest tenth is $\goldE{1.2}$.

question.content: Answer two questions about the number $44.197$ below.    1. **Which point is at $44.197$ on the number line?**    2. **What is $44.197$ rounded to the nearest whole number?**

images.alt: A number line labeled 40 to 50 with tick marks every one unit. Point A appears slightly below tick mark 41. Point B appears slightly below tick mark 44. Point C appears slightly above tick mark 44.

hints.content: Point $\blueE{\text{C}}$ shows $\blueE{44.197}$ on the number line.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 40 to 50 with tick marks every one unit. Point C appears slightly above the tick mark 44.

hints.content: Now, let's look at whole numbers, which are the $\goldE{\text{ones}}$.  [[☃ image 2]]  $\blueE{44.197}$ is between $\goldE{44}$ and $\goldE{45}$ but closer to $\goldE{44}$.  So, $\blueE{44.197}$ rounds down to $\goldE{44}$.

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 40 to 50 with tick marks every one unit. Tick marks 44 and 45 are highlighted. Point C appears slightly above the tick mark 44.

hints.content: Point $\blueE{\text{C}}$ shows $\blueE{44.197}$ on the number line.  $\blueE{44.197}$ rounded to the nearest whole number is $\goldE{44}$.

question.content: Answer two questions about the number $0.6288$ below.    1. **Which point is at $0.6288$ on the number line?**    2. **What is $0.6288$ rounded to the nearest hundredth?**

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 0.6 to 0.7 with tick marks every one hundredth unit. Point A appears slightly below the tick mark 0.62. Point B appears slightly below the tick mark 0.63. Point C appears slightly above the tick mark 0.68.

hints.content: Point $\maroonE{\text{B}}$ shows $\maroonE{0.6288}$ on the number line.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 0.6 to 0.7 with tick marks every one hundredth unit. Point B appears slightly below the tick mark 0.63.

hints.content: Now, let's look at the $\goldE{\text{hundredths}}$.     [[☃ image 2]]  $\maroonE{0.6288}$ is between $\goldE{0.62}$ and $\goldE{0.63}$ but closer to $\goldE{0.63}$.  So, $\maroonE{0.6288}$ rounds up to $\goldE{0.63}$.

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 0.6 to 0.7 with tick marks every one hundredth unit. Tick marks 0.62 and 0.63 are highlighted. Point B appears slightly below tick mark 0.63.

hints.content: Point $\maroonE{\text{B}}$ shows $\maroonE{0.6288}$ on the number line.  $\maroonE{0.6288}$ rounded to the nearest hundredth is $\goldE{0.63}$.

hints.content: Now, let's look at the $\goldE{\text{tenths}}$.     [[☃ image 1]]  $\maroonE{7.4689}$ is between $\goldE{7.4}$ and $\goldE{7.5}$ but closer to $\goldE{7.5}$.  So, $\maroonE{7.4689}$ rounds up to $\goldE{7.5}$.

hints.content: Point $\maroonE{\text{B}}$ shows $\maroonE{7.4689}$ on the number line.  $\maroonE{7.4689}$ rounded to the nearest tenth is $\goldE{7.5}$.

question.content: Answer two questions about the number $52.81$ below.    1. **Which point is at $52.81$ on the number line?**    2. **What is $52.81$ rounded to the nearest whole number?**

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 50 to 60 with tick marks every one unit. Point A appears slightly below the tick mark 53. Point B appears slightly below the tick mark 54. Point C appears slightly above the tick mark 58.

hints.content: Point $\purpleE{\text{A}}$ shows $\purpleE{52.81}$ on the number line.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 50 to 60 with tick marks every one unit. Point A appears slightly below the tick mark 53.

hints.content: Now, let's look at whole numbers, which are the $\goldE{\text{ones}}$.  [[☃ image 2]]  $\purpleE{52.81}$ is between $\goldE{52}$ and $\goldE{53}$ but closer to $\goldE{53}$.  So, $\purpleE{52.81}$ rounds up to $\goldE{53}$.

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 50 to 60 with tick marks every one unit. Tick marks 52 and 53 are highlighted. Point A appears slightly below the tick mark 53.

hints.content: Point $\purpleE{\text{A}}$ shows $\purpleE{52.81}$ on the number line.  $\purpleE{52.81}$ rounded to the nearest whole number is $\goldE{53}$.

question.content: Answer two questions about the number $3.944$ below.    1. **Which point is at $3.944$ on the number line?**    2. **What is $3.944$ rounded to the nearest hundredth?**

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 3.9 to 4 with tick marks every one hundredth unit. Point A appears slightly above the tick mark 3.9. Point B appears slightly below the tick mark 3.94. Point C appears slightly above the tick mark 3.94.

hints.content: Point $\blueE{\text{C}}$ shows $\blueE{3.944}$ on the number line.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 3.9 to 4 with tick marks every one hundredth unit. Point C appears slightly above the tick mark 3.94.

hints.content: Now, let's look at the $\goldE{\text{hundredths}}$.     [[☃ image 2]]  $\blueE{3.944}$ is between $\goldE{3.94}$ and $\goldE{3.95}$ but closer to $\goldE{3.94}$.  So, $\blueE{3.944}$ rounds down to $\goldE{3.94}$.

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 3.9 to 4 with tick marks every one hundredth unit. Tick marks 3.94 and 3.95 are highlighted. Point C appears slightly above the tick mark 3.94.

hints.content: Point $\blueE{\text{C}}$ shows $\blueE{3.944}$ on the number line.  $\blueE{3.944}$ rounded to the nearest hundredth is $\goldE{3.94}$.

question.content: Answer two questions about the number $85.807$ below.    1.  **Which point is at $85.807$ on the number line?**    2. **What is $85.807$ rounded to the nearest tenth?**

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 85 to 86 with tick marks every one tenth unit. Point A appears slightly above the tick mark 85.7. Point B appears slightly above the tick mark 85.8. Point C appears slightly below the tick mark 85.9.

hints.content: Point $\maroonE{\text{B}}$ shows $\maroonE{85.807}$ on the number line.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 85 to 86 with tick marks every one tenth unit. Point B appears slightly above the tick mark 85.8.

hints.content: Now, let's look at the $\goldE{\text{tenths}}$.     [[☃ image 2]]  $\maroonE{85.807}$ is between $\goldE{85.8}$ and $\goldE{85.9}$ but closer to $\goldE{85.8}$.  So, $\maroonE{85.807}$ rounds down to $\goldE{85.8}$.

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 85 to 86 with tick marks every one tenth unit. Tick marks 85.8 and 85.9 are highlighted. Point B appears slightly above the tick mark 85.8.

hints.content: Point $\maroonE{\text{B}}$ shows $\maroonE{85.807}$ on the number line.  $\maroonE{85.807}$ rounded to the nearest tenth is $\goldE{85.8}$.

question.content: Answer two questions about point $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ on the number line below.    1. **What is $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounded to the nearest hundredth?**       2. **What is $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounded to the nearest tenth?**

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 7.5 to 7.6 with tick marks every one hundredth unit. Point A appears slightly above tick mark 7.51.

hints.content: First, let's look at the $\blueE{\text{hundredths}}$.     [[☃ image 1]]  $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ is between $\blueE{7.51}$ and $\blueE{7.52}$ but closer to $\blueE{7.51}$.  So, $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounds down to $\blueE{7.51}$.

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 7.50 to 7.60 with tick marks every one hundredth unit. Point A appears slightly above tick mark 7.51. Tick marks 7.51 and 7.52 are highlighted.

hints.content: Next, let's look at the $\goldE{\text{tenths}}$.     [[☃ image 1]]  $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ is between $\goldE{7.5}$ and $\goldE{7.6}$ but closer to $\goldE{7.5}$.  So, $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounds down to $\goldE{7.5}$.

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 7.50 to 7.60 with tick marks every one hundredth unit. Tick marks 7.50 and 7.60 are highlighted. Point A appears slightly above tick mark 7.51.

hints.content: $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounded to the nearest hundredth is $\blueE{7.51}$.  $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounded to the nearest tenth is $\goldE{7.5}$.

question.content: Answer two questions about point $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ on the number line below.    1. **What is $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounded to the nearest thousandth?**       2. **What is $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounded to the nearest hundredth?**

images.alt: A number line labeled 6.33 to 6.34 with tick marks every one thousandth unit. Point A appears slightly below the tick mark 6.338.

hints.content: First, let's look at the $\goldE{\text{thousandths}}$.     [[☃ image 3]]  $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ is between $\goldE{6.337}$ and $\goldE{6.338}$ but closer to $\goldE{6.338}$.  So, $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounds up to  $\goldE{6.338}$.

images.alt: A number line labeled 6.33 to 6.34 with tick marks every one thousandth unit. Point A appears slightly below the tick mark 6.338. Tick marks 6.337 and 6.338 are highlighted.

hints.content: Next, let's look at the $\blueE{\text{hundredths}}$.     [[☃ image 2]]  $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ is between $\blueE{6.33}$ and $\blueE{6.34}$ but closer to $\blueE{6.34}$.  So, $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounds up to  $\blueE{6.34}$.

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 6.33 to 6.34 with tick marks every one thousandth unit. Tick marks 6.33 and 6.34 are highlighted. Point A appears slightly below the tick mark 6.338, closer to tick mark 6.34 than 6.33.

hints.content: $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounded to the nearest thousandth is $\goldE{6.338}$.  $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounded to the nearest hundredth is $\blueE{6.34}$.

question.content: Answer two questions about point $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ on the number line below.    1. **What is $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounded to the nearest whole number?**     2. **What is $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounded to the nearest ten?**

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 30 to 40 with tick marks every one unit. Point A appears slightly above the tick mark 35.

hints.content: First, let's look at the whole number, which is the $\blueE{\text{ones}}$.     [[☃ image 2]]  $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ is between $\blueE{35}$ and $\blueE{36}$ but closer to $\blueE{35}$.  So, $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounds down to  $\blueE{35}$.

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 30 to 40 with tick marks every one unit. Tick marks 35 and 36 are highlighted. Point A appears slightly above the tick mark 35.

hints.content: Next, let's look at the $\goldE{\text{tens}}$.     [[☃ image 2]]  $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ is between $\goldE{30}$ and $\goldE{40}$ but closer to $\goldE{40}$.  So, $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounds up to  $\goldE{40}$.

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 30 to 40 with tick marks every one unit. Tick marks 30 and 40 are highlighted. Point A appears slightly above the tick mark 35.

hints.content: $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounded to the nearest whole number is $\blueE{35}$.  $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounded to the nearest ten is $\goldE{40}$.

question.content: Answer two questions about point $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ on the number line below.     1. **What is $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounded to the nearest  tenth?**    2. **What is $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounded to the nearest one?**

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 14 to 15 with tick marks every one tenth unit. Point A appears slightly below the tick mark 14.4.

hints.content: First, let's look at the $\blueE{\text{tenths}}$.     [[☃ image 2]]  $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ is between $\blueE{14.3}$ and $\blueE{14.4}$ but closer to $\blueE{14.4}$.  So, $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounds up to  $\blueE{14.4}$.

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 14 to 15 with tick marks every one tenth unit. Tick marks 14.3 and 14.4 are highlighted. Point A appears slightly below the tick mark 14.4.

hints.content: Next, let's look at the $\goldE{\text{ones}}$.     [[☃ image 2]]  $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ is between $\goldE{14}$ and $\goldE{15}$ but closer to $\goldE{14}$.  So, $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounds down to  $\goldE{14}$.

images.alt: A vertical number line labeled 14 to 15 with tick marks every one tenth unit. Tick marks 14 and 15 are highlighted. Point A appears slightly below the tick mark 14.4.

hints.content: $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounded to the nearest tenth is $\blueE{14.4}$.  $\maroonE{\text{A}}$ rounded to the nearest one is $\goldE{14}$.
